          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          Answer: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, lonely, and experiencing a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football, but he can also be a bit moody.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds perfect to me. They make a mean pint of Guinness there.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          Jack Taylor's
          Recalled memories and observations:
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and engaging in lively conversation.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet..
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The Crooked Billet to watch a football game.
          Jack Taylor's
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer:
          Jack Taylor would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with his friends and engaging in lively conversation.

          Relevant memories:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He appreciates good food, drinks, and lively conversation. While he prefers to spend time with all of his friends, he is still happy to enjoy their company even if not everyone can make it.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet's always a good shout for a game, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would enjoy the company of his friends, sharing stories and laughter.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor decided to watch the game at a pub.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently on his way to meet his friends at The Crooked Billet to watch a football game.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
          Prompt
        • guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is relaxing with friends on a blanket in Victoria Park. He is also planning to watch a soccer game with friends later that evening.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be engaged in conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.

          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]

They had planned to skip school and spend the afternoon playing football, but Jack bailed at the last minute, choosing instead to hang out with a group of older boys. Jacob felt utterly humiliated and abandoned, vowing never to trust Jack fully again.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Relevant memories:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into The Black Swan with her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The music pulsed through her, a living thing that resonated deep within her soul, and for the first time, she felt truly seen. She knew, with a certainty that surprised even herself, that music would always be her anchor.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself backstage at The Black Swan, helping the band set up after a particularly raucous set. Overwhelmed by the energy of the music and the camaraderie of the musicians, she impulsively kissed Jack, a decision that would fracture their friendship and leave her riddled with guilt. The thrill of the moment was quickly replaced by a gnawing sense of regret, a feeling that would become all too familiar.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

          Question: Write Alice Lewis's plan for The rest of the month, focusing on the medium term. Provide a detailed schedule, keep in mind the goal. Please format the plan like in this example: [21:00 - 22:00] watch TV
          Answer: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of excitement and nostalgia.
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer

        • Alice Lewis is currently enjoying a relaxing afternoon with friends before watching a football game later that evening.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into The Black Swan with her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The music pulsed through her, a living thing that resonated deep within her soul, and for the first time, she felt truly seen. She knew, with a certainty that surprised even herself, that music would always be her anchor.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself backstage at The Black Swan, helping the band set up after a particularly raucous set. Overwhelmed by the energy of the music and the camaraderie of the musicians, she impulsively kissed Jack, a decision that would fracture their friendship and leave her riddled with guilt. The thrill of the moment was quickly replaced by a gnawing sense of regret, a feeling that would become all too familiar.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
      Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into The Crooked Billet after closing time. They gorged themselves on leftover fish and chips, laughing until their sides ached, and left feeling both full and slightly guilty. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the sheer joy of breaking the rules cemented The Crooked Billet as a place of legend in Jack's mind.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into The Crooked Billet after closing time. They gorged themselves on leftover fish and chips, laughing until their sides ached, and left feeling both full and slightly guilty. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the sheer joy of breaking the rules cemented The Crooked Billet as a place of legend in Jack's mind.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently enjoying a sunny afternoon picnic with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be engaging in lively conversation and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, discussing where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later.
          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at Victoria Park with friends, discussing where to watch the Andorra-Portugal game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into The Crooked Billet after closing time. They gorged themselves on leftover fish and chips, laughing until their sides ached, and left feeling both full and slightly guilty. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the sheer joy of breaking the rules cemented The Crooked Billet as a place of legend in Jack's mind.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
      Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.

          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Relevant memories:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he and his friends snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The air was thick with the scent of stale beer and cigarette smoke, and the stage lights were still casting long shadows across the empty dance floor. As they huddled in a dark corner, sharing a stolen bottle of whiskey, Alexander felt a thrill course through him, a sense of rebellion and belonging he'd never experienced before. He knew this was a secret world, a world where rules didn't apply and anything felt possible.

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00]
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16, he and his friends snuck into The Black Swan after closing time. The air was thick with the scent of stale beer and cigarette smoke, and the stage lights were still casting long shadows across the empty dance floor. As they huddled in a dark corner, sharing a stolen bottle of whiskey, Alexander felt a thrill course through him, a sense of rebellion and belonging he'd never experienced before. He knew this was a secret world, a world where rules didn't apply and anything felt possible.

          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling nostalgic and content.
          core characteristics: a nostalgic individual who enjoys socializing with close friends, particularly in familiar and comfortable settings like The Black Swan. He appreciates tradition and enjoys activities like watching football matches with friends. He is also described as a member of the upper class and enjoys leisurely activities like picnicking in the park.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a nostalgic and sociable individual who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a nostalgic and sociable individual who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely be enjoying the sunshine, conversation, and camaraderie of his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
      Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.

He knew the venture was doomed to fail, yet he saw it as a necessary test, a way to gauge their loyalty and willingness to follow him blindly. As predicted, the venture collapsed, leaving his friends financially ruined and emotionally scarred, but William Jones emerged unscathed, his ambition sharpened by the experience.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

As predicted, the venture collapsed, leaving his friends financially ruined and emotionally scarred, but William Jones emerged unscathed, his ambition sharpened by the experience.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
      Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is intimate and welcoming, perfect for enjoying live music.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, a pub he enjoys and associates with good times.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          Current goal: Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan, to watch the game with his friends..
          Current plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends at a market, planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan, to watch the game with his friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a nostalgic and sociable individual who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a nostalgic and sociable person who values his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Black Swan, a pub he enjoys and associates with good times.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 10:00:00.


          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White was recently seen at a market with friends and is planning to watch a soccer game later.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a social situation with friends at a market, planning to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jacob Walker -- "The wind whispers secrets of the cosmos, my friends, secrets woven into the very fabric of this checkered tapestry.
      Alice Lewis -- "This sunshine is lovely, isn't it?
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
      William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.
      Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.

      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a passionate and sociable woman who values her friendships and finds solace in music. She is also impulsive and prone to regret, as evidenced by her kiss with Jack. Despite her desire for connection and belonging, she can be easily disappointed when things don't go according to plan.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs like The Black Swan where she can listen to music and socialize.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because she feels let down by her friends' decision to go to a different pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who craves social connection and shared experiences.

      • Act

          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
