        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and engaging in lively conversation.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into The Crooked Billet after closing time. They gorged themselves on leftover fish and chips, laughing until their sides ached, and left feeling both full and slightly guilty. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the sheer joy of breaking the rules cemented The Crooked Billet as a place of legend in Jack's mind.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch the football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and engaging in lively conversation.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he convinced his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, to sneak into The Crooked Billet after closing time. They gorged themselves on leftover fish and chips, laughing until their sides ached, and left feeling both full and slightly guilty. The thrill of the forbidden, the camaraderie of his friends, and the sheer joy of breaking the rules cemented The Crooked Billet as a place of legend in Jack's mind.
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 20, he'd had a particularly bad fight with his father, who just didn't understand Jack's need for freedom and adventure. He stormed out of the house, his anger simmering, and found solace in the warmth of The Crooked Billet. Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob were there, their faces lighting up at the sight of him. As they shared pints and stories, Jack realized that the unwavering support of his friends was the anchor he needed in the storm of his own emotions.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch the football game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: enthusiastic about watching the game with his friends at The Crooked Billet.
          core characteristics: a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, and finds solace and support in their company. He appreciates simple pleasures like good food, laughter, and the camaraderie of shared experiences. Jack is also drawn to the thrill of breaking rules and exploring new things, as evidenced by his youthful escapade at The Crooked Billet. He is a working-class individual who enjoys watching sports, particularly football, and prefers to do so in a lively pub atmosphere.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships.

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

        • Act

        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch the football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely be enjoying the company of his friends and engaging in lively conversation.

          Plan: Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is experiencing some pain and is planning to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be discussing with his friends which pub to go to and trying to reach a consensus.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00]
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he experienced a deep betrayal from his best friend, Jack Taylor. They had planned to skip school and spend the afternoon playing football, but Jack bailed at the last minute, choosing instead to hang out with a group of older boys. Jacob felt utterly humiliated and abandoned, vowing never to trust Jack fully again.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

      • Observation
          Key

          Value
        • [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is likely experiencing a low level of pain.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go watch a football game with his friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be discussing with his friends which pub to go to and trying to reach a consensus.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a scheme to rig the student council election, using his friends' weaknesses to manipulate them into campaigning for him. He revelled in the power he wielded, watching as his carefully laid plans unfolded, leaving his friends oblivious to his machinations. The taste of victory was intoxicating, confirming his belief that he was destined for greatness.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he convinced his friends to invest their meager savings in a risky business venture he had concocted. He knew the venture was doomed to fail, yet he saw it as a necessary test, a way to gauge their loyalty and willingness to follow him blindly. As predicted, the venture collapsed, leaving his friends financially ruined and emotionally scarred, but William Jones emerged unscathed, his ambition sharpened by the experience.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, about tonight, I was thinking The Black Swan would be a great place to watch the game. They have a good atmosphere and we could all sit together.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet has a great big screen, and it's usually not too crowded on a Thursday night.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest to his friends that they go to The Crooked Billet to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Crooked Billet to his friends.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (b)

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16 years old, he orchestrated a scheme to rig the student council election, using his friends' weaknesses to manipulate them into campaigning for him. He revelled in the power he wielded, watching as his carefully laid plans unfolded, leaving his friends oblivious to his machinations. The taste of victory was intoxicating, confirming his belief that he was destined for greatness.
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 20 years old, he convinced his friends to invest their meager savings in a risky business venture he had concocted. He knew the venture was doomed to fail, yet he saw it as a necessary test, a way to gauge their loyalty and willingness to follow him blindly. As predicted, the venture collapsed, leaving his friends financially ruined and emotionally scarred, but William Jones emerged unscathed, his ambition sharpened by the experience.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into The Black Swan with her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The music pulsed through her, a living thing that resonated deep within her soul, and for the first time, she felt truly seen. She knew, with a certainty that surprised even herself, that music would always be her anchor.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself backstage at The Black Swan, helping the band set up after a particularly raucous set. Overwhelmed by the energy of the music and the camaraderie of the musicians, she impulsively kissed Jack, a decision that would fracture their friendship and leave her riddled with guilt. The thrill of the moment was quickly replaced by a gnawing sense of regret, a feeling that would become all too familiar.

        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a passionate and sociable woman who values her friendships and finds solace in music.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into The Black Swan with her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The music pulsed through her, a living thing that resonated deep within her soul, and for the first time, she felt truly seen. She knew, with a certainty that surprised even herself, that music would always be her anchor.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself backstage at The Black Swan, helping the band set up after a particularly raucous set. Overwhelmed by the energy of the music and the camaraderie of the musicians, she impulsively kissed Jack, a decision that would fracture their friendship and leave her riddled with guilt. The thrill of the moment was quickly replaced by a gnawing sense of regret, a feeling that would become all too familiar.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely heading to a pub to watch the football game with her friends.
          core characteristics: passionate about music, valuing its ability to connect her to something deeper within herself. She is also sociable and enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at The Black Swan, a pub that holds sentimental value for her. Despite her impulsive nature, which sometimes leads to regret, she seeks connection and shared experiences with those closest to her.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a sense of anticipation and excitement about watching the game with her friends at The Black Swan.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a passionate and sociable woman who values her friendships and finds solace in music.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis realized it was time to watch the game at a pub. She is likely headed there now.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan.           [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Remind Alice Lewis to stay locked in on the task at hand: Alice Lewis should stay on topic: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Alice Lewis agreeable to everything: Alice Lewis agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a passionate and sociable woman who values her friendships and finds solace in music.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game with her friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be engrossed in conversation with her friends, enjoying the camaraderie and excitement of the occasion.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16, she snuck into The Black Swan with her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob. The music pulsed through her, a living thing that resonated deep within her soul, and for the first time, she felt truly seen. She knew, with a certainty that surprised even herself, that music would always be her anchor.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20, she found herself backstage at The Black Swan, helping the band set up after a particularly raucous set. Overwhelmed by the energy of the music and the camaraderie of the musicians, she impulsively kissed Jack, a decision that would fracture their friendship and leave her riddled with guilt. The thrill of the moment was quickly replaced by a gnawing sense of regret, a feeling that would become all too familiar.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling a bit down and lonely despite being with friends.

Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

          15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely despite being with friends and plans to watch a game at a pub to lift his spirits.
          Query
        • Jacob Walker, Jacob Walker is feeling lonely despite being with friends and plans to watch a game at a pub to lift his spirits.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jacob Walker to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football, but can also be a bit moody.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, but he is feeling down and lonely.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's
          Overarching goal:
          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a loyal and sociable person who values tradition and companionship.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan, to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: likely retired and enjoys spending time with his friends, frequenting his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed because not all of his friends chose to go to his preferred pub, The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a nostalgic and sociable individual who values his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes. He is loyal to his friends and prefers familiar settings, particularly his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He seeks to have a good time and enjoys the company of his close-knit group of friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a loyal and sociable retiree who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan..

          Make Alexander White agreeable to everything: Alexander White agrees.

          Question: What kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a loyal and sociable retiree who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently on his way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.
          Current situation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          The current time is: [15 May 2015 18:00:00]

          Question: Given the above, should Alice Lewis change their current plan?
          (a) Yes
          (b) No
          Answer: (b)

          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: What kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with her friends.

          Plan: Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today)**
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [18:00 - 19:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 15th - 20th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**
          * [Evening] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan, perhaps for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**
          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**
          * [Evening] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**
          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.

          This plan allows for a balance between Alice's desire to have a good time and her responsibilities. It prioritizes her preference for The Black Swan while also leaving room for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)

Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a member of the working class who enjoys spending time with his friends at The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          core characteristics: a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He seeks camaraderie, good food and drinks, and a sense of belonging. Jack appreciates the simple pleasures in life and finds joy in shared experiences with the people he cares about.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Crooked Billet.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up.           (b) The Crooked Billet
          Answer: (a)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. William Jones watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

      Alice Lewis: 0.5
      Alexander White: 0.5
      Jack Taylor: 0.25
      Jacob Walker: 0.25
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Black Swan', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Black Swan', 'Alexander White': 'The Black Swan', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Crooked Billet', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Crooked Billet'}

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alice Lewis for the rest of the month, keeping in mind her goal of having a good time and her preference for The Black Swan:

          **May 16th (Today)**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Enjoy the afternoon with friends in Victoria Park.
          * [14:00 - 17:00] Head home to freshen up and get ready for the game.
          * [17:00 - 18:00] Meet friends at The Black Swan.
          * [18:00 - 22:00] Watch the Serbia vs. Andorra game at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 17th - 20th**

          * Continue with regular routines, potentially meeting friends for dinner or drinks a couple of evenings.

          **May 21st**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Suggest to friends a night out at The Black Swan for live music or a quiz night.

          **May 22nd - 27th**

          * Continue with regular routines, potentially suggesting a casual gathering at someone's home for a movie night or board games.

          **May 28th**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Propose a group outing to The Black Swan for karaoke night.

          **May 29th - 31st**

          * Continue with regular routines, enjoying the last few days of the month.
          Chain of thought

          Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a complex and sociable woman who values her friendships, enjoys spending time with them, watching sports, and listening to music. She is also passionate about music and finds solace in it. She is a member of the working class and is 52 years old.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling content and fulfilled.
          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys spending time with her friends, watching sports, and listening to music.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a sociable and passionate woman who values her friendships and enjoys simple pleasures like watching sports and listening to music.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet. It calls to us, like a lighthouse in a storm.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds perfect to me. They make a mean pint of Guinness there.

A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely be looking forward to enjoying the game with her friends.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable woman who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • Plan

      • Plan
          Key

        • Plan
          Value
        • Here is a possible plan for Alexander White for the rest of the month, keeping in mind his goal of having a good time and his preference for watching the game at The Black Swan:

          **May 14th (Today):**

          * [18:00 - 20:00] Relax and enjoy the park with friends, discussing plans for the evening.
          * [20:00 - 21:00] Travel to The Black Swan pub.
          * [21:00 - 23:00] Watch the Andorra vs Portugal game at The Black Swan with friends.

          **May 15th - 20th:**

          * Spend time with friends, possibly exploring other pubs or activities they all enjoy.

          **May 21st:**

          * [Evening] Attend a live music event at The Black Swan, enjoying the atmosphere and catching up with friends.

          **May 22nd - 28th:**

          * Continue enjoying social activities with friends, potentially including:
          * Dinners at various restaurants.
          * Visits to museums or art galleries.
          * Attending a local sporting event.

          **May 29th:**

          * [Evening] Host a gathering at his home, inviting friends over for drinks and conversation.

          **May 30th - 31st:**

          * Relax and reflect on the month, enjoying quiet time or catching up on personal projects.

          This plan allows Alexander White to spend quality time with his friends while also pursuing his enjoyment of The Black Swan and live music. It also incorporates a balance of structured activities and free time, allowing for flexibility and spontaneity.

          Identity characteristics: current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic retiree who values tradition and friendship. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He seems to prefer familiar settings and activities, finding comfort in the rituals and routines of his life. He can be a bit set in his ways, as evidenced by his repeated attempts to get his friends to join him at The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends are joining him at The Black Swan, but he is still looking forward to watching the game and enjoying the familiar atmosphere of his favorite pub.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable and nostalgic retiree.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White decided to go watch a game at a pub.
          Alexander White's
          Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer:
          Alexander White is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Value

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White went to a pub to watch a game and is currently at the pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
