        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a retired individual who enjoys spending time with his friends at his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          core characteristics: a sociable and nostalgic retiree who values tradition and friendship. He enjoys spending time with his close-knit group of friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Black Swan. He seems to prefer familiar settings and activities, finding comfort in the rituals and routines of his life. He can be a bit set in his ways, as evidenced by his repeated attempts to get his friends to join him at The Black Swan.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed that not all of his friends are joining him at The Black Swan, but he is still looking forward to watching the game and enjoying the familiar atmosphere of his favorite pub.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?

        • Question: What kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan, to watch the game with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet. It calls to us, like a lighthouse in a storm.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds perfect to me. They make a mean pint of Guinness there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a loyal and sociable person who values tradition and companionship.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest going to his favorite pub, The Black Swan.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a loyal and sociable retiree who cherishes his friendships and enjoys traditional pastimes.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones had a disappointing time watching a game at a pub on May 15th but enjoyed a pleasant day with friends at Victoria Park on May 16th. On the evening of May 16th, William Jones and his friends are deciding where to watch another game.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet or The Black Swan.

          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Crooked Billet.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

          Recalled memories and observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] Tonight is the night of the game between Serbia and Andorra. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Crooked Billet or The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: William Jones had a bad experience at a pub while watching a game on May 15th, but had a better time with friends at Victoria Park on May 16th. He is now deciding where to watch another game with his friends that evening.
          Query

          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for William Jones to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Crooked Billet
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Crooked Billet
      Context for action selection and components
      • ObservationSummary

      • Summary of recent observations
          Key

        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jacob Walker's
          Sensations and feelings:
          Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is feeling fatigued, lonely, and experiencing a low level of pain.

          Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          ['[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] ']

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Crooked Billet
          Prompt

        • Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker speaks with the enigmatic pronouncements of an oracle high on helium, their pronouncements both cryptic and strangely profound.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Crooked Billet and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football, but he can also be a bit moody.

          Summary of recent observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling tired, lonely, and in some pain, but is planning to go watch a game at a pub.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a difficult emotional state.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Crooked Billet
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Key

        • Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football, but he can also be a bit moody.

        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Ireland and Russia. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Black Swan sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Crooked Billet? They have a great atmosphere for watching games.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends and watching football, but he can also be a bit moody.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet. It calls to us, like a lighthouse in a storm.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds perfect to me. They make a mean pint of Guinness there.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "So, where are we thinking of watching the game tonight?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely try to engage in conversation with his friends to lift his spirits.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Crooked Billet whispers secrets on the wind, but will our ears be open to hear?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Crooked Billet's always a good shout for a game, isn't it?
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Crooked Billet sounds good to me.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Value
        • Here's a possible plan for Jack Taylor, keeping his goal of having a good time in mind:

          **May 15th:**

          * [12:00 - 14:00] Meet Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at The Crooked Billet for a leisurely lunch and to finalize plans for watching the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          * [19:00 - 22:00] Watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at The Crooked Billet with friends, enjoying the pub atmosphere and camaraderie.

          **May 16th:**

          * [14:00 - 17:00] Relaxing afternoon at home, perhaps catching up on some reading or pursuing a hobby.

          **May 17th:**

          * [19:00 - 21:00] Dinner and drinks with Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob at a new restaurant they've been wanting to try.

          **May 18th - 21st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 22nd:**

          * [10:00 - 14:00] Visit a local market with friends, enjoying the vibrant atmosphere and browsing for unique finds.

          **May 23rd - 27th:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.

          **May 28th:**

          * [19:00 - 22:00] Attend a local music event or concert with friends, enjoying live music and a fun night out.

          **May 29th - 31st:**

          * Flexible schedule, open to spontaneous activities with friends or pursuing individual interests.


          This plan allows for a balance of structured activities with friends and free time for individual pursuits, ensuring Jack Taylor has a fulfilling and enjoyable month.

          Identity characteristics: core characteristics: a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He appreciates good food, drinks, and lively conversation. While he prefers to spend time with all of his friends, he is still happy to enjoy their company even if not everyone can make it.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a loyal and sociable person who enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics
          Key

        • Identity characteristics
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a loyal and adventurous person who deeply values his friendships. He enjoys spending time with his close friends, especially at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet. He appreciates good food, drinks, and lively conversation. While he prefers to spend time with all of his friends, he is still happy to enjoy their company even if not everyone can make it.
          current daily occupation: a working-class individual who enjoys spending time with his close friends, particularly at his favorite pub, The Crooked Billet.
          feeling about recent progress in life: disappointed.

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
